questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.question: Who is making the Web standards?
questions.explanation: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) develops the standards for the Web.

questions.question: Choose the correct HTML element for the largest heading:
questions.explanation: <h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML element for inserting a line break?
questions.explanation: is used to insert a single line break.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for adding a background color?
questions.explanation: The style attribute specifies an inline style for an element.

questions.question: Choose the correct HTML element to define important text:
questions.explanation: The <strong> element is used to define text with strong importance.

questions.question: Choose the correct HTML element to define emphasized text:
questions.explanation: The <em> element is used to define emphasized text.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> tag defines a hyperlink, and the 'href' attribute specifies the destination address.

questions.question: Which character is used to indicate an end tag?
questions.explanation: The forward slash (/) is used to indicate the end of an HTML tag.

questions.question: How can you make a numbered list?
questions.explanation: <ol> defines an ordered (numbered) list.

questions.question: How can you make a bulleted list?
questions.explanation: <ul> defines an unordered (bulleted) list.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a checkbox?
questions.explanation: <input type="checkbox"> defines a checkbox.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a text input field?
questions.explanation: <input type="text"> defines a single-line text input field.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a drop-down list?
questions.explanation: The <select> element is used to create a drop-down list.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a text area?
questions.explanation: The <textarea> element defines a multi-line text input control.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for inserting an image?
questions.explanation: The tag is used to embed an image in an HTML page, using the 'src' attribute.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for inserting a background image?
questions.explanation: CSS background-image property is the standard way to add background images.

questions.question: An <iframe> is used to display a web page within a web page.
questions.explanation: An <iframe> (inline frame) is used to embed another document within the current HTML document.

questions.question: HTML comments start with <!-- and end with -->
questions.explanation: HTML comments are not displayed in the browser and use the <!-- ... --> syntax.

questions.question: Block elements are normally displayed without starting a new line.
questions.explanation: Block-level elements always start on a new line and take up the full width available.

questions.question: Which HTML element defines navigation links?
questions.explanation: The <nav> element defines a set of navigation links.

questions.question: In HTML, which attribute is used to specify that an input field must be filled out?
questions.explanation: The 'required' attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
questions.explanation: The <footer> element defines a footer for a document or section.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML element for playing video files?
questions.explanation: The <video> element is used to embed video content in a document.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML element for playing audio files?
questions.explanation: The <audio> element is used to embed sound content in a document.

questions.question: The HTML <canvas> element is used to:
options: draw graphics, on the fly, via scripting (usually JavaScript)
questions.explanation: The <canvas> element is used to draw graphics on a web page via JavaScript.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to display a scalar measurement within a range?
questions.explanation: The <meter> element defines a scalar measurement within a known range (a gauge).

questions.question: Which HTML element defines a title for the document?
questions.explanation: The <title> element defines a title in the browser toolbar, provides a title for the page when it is added to favorites, and displays a title for the page in search-engine results.

questions.question: Which attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image cannot be displayed?
questions.explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides an alternate text for an image.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to specify a header for a document or section?
questions.explanation: The <header> element represents a container for introductory content or a set of navigation links.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for referring to an external style sheet?
questions.explanation: The <link> tag is used to link to external style sheets.

questions.question: Where in an HTML document is the correct place to refer to an external style sheet?
options: At the end of the document
questions.explanation: External styles are defined within the <link> element, inside the <head> section of an HTML page.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define an internal style sheet?
questions.explanation: The <style> tag is used to define internal CSS.

questions.question: Which HTML attribute is used to define inline styles?
questions.explanation: The 'style' attribute is used for inline styles.

questions.question: Which is the correct CSS syntax?
questions.explanation: The correct format is selector { property: value; }.

questions.question: How do you insert a comment in a CSS file?
questions.explanation: CSS comments start with /* and end with */.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the background color?
questions.explanation: The 'background-color' property specifies the background color of an element.

questions.question: How do you add a background color for all <h1> elements?
questions.explanation: Select all <h1> elements and set their 'background-color' property.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property specifies the color of text.

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the text size?
questions.explanation: The 'font-size' property sets the size of the font.

questions.question:
What is the correct CSS syntax for making all the

elements bold?
questions.explanation: The 'font-weight' property sets how thick or thin characters in text should be displayed.

questions.question: How do you display hyperlinks without an underline?
questions.explanation: The 'text-decoration' property is used to add or remove decorations from text. 'none' removes the underline.

questions.question: How do you make each word in a text start with a capital letter?
options: You can't do that with CSS
questions.explanation: The 'text-transform' property controls the capitalization of text. 'capitalize' transforms the first character of each word to uppercase.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the font of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'font-family' property specifies the font for an element.

questions.question: How do you make the text bold?
questions.explanation: 'font-weight:bold' makes the text bold.

questions.question: Which property is used to create space between the element's border and inner content?
questions.explanation: Padding is the space between the content and the border.

questions.question: How do you select an element with id 'demo'?
questions.explanation: The # selector is used to select an element with a specific id.

questions.question: How do you select elements with class name 'test'?
questions.explanation: The . selector is used to select elements with a specific class.

questions.question: How do you select all p elements inside a div element?
questions.explanation: The descendant selector (space) matches all elements that are descendants of a specified element.

questions.question: What is the default value of the position property?
questions.explanation: The default value for the position property is 'static'.

questions.question: How do you make an element stay in the same position even if the page is scrolled?
questions.explanation: An element with 'position: fixed' is positioned relative to the viewport, which means it always stays in the same place even if the page is scrolled.

questions.question: What is the z-index property used for?
options: To set the zoom level of an element
To set the stack order of an element
To set the size of an element
questions.explanation: The 'z-index' property specifies the stack order of an element (which element should be placed in front of, or behind, the others).

questions.question: Which property is used to center an element horizontally if it has a fixed width?
questions.explanation: 'margin: auto' is used to horizontally center an element within its container.

questions.question: Which value of the display property makes an element disappear from the page?
questions.explanation: 'display: none' removes the element from the document flow.

questions.question: What is the difference between visibility:hidden and display:none?
options: visibility:hidden leaves the space, display:none removes the space
display:none leaves the space, visibility:hidden removes the space
questions.explanation: 'visibility: hidden' hides an element, but it still takes up the same space as before. 'display: none' removes it completely from the layout.

questions.question: Which property is used to create a flex container?
questions.explanation: 'display: flex' or 'display: inline-flex' defines a flex container.

questions.question: In Flexbox, which property is used to align items along the main axis?
questions.explanation: 'justify-content' aligns flex items along the main axis.

questions.question: In Flexbox, which property is used to align items along the cross axis?
questions.explanation: 'align-items' defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on the current line.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the direction of flex items?
questions.explanation: The 'flex-direction' property specifies the direction of the flexible items.

questions.question: What is the CSS Grid property to define the number of columns?
questions.explanation: 'grid-template-columns' defines the columns of the grid.

questions.question: Which CSS property allows you to specify whether or not an element's background should be fixed or scroll with the rest of the page?
questions.explanation: The 'background-attachment' property sets whether a background image is fixed or scrolls with the rest of the page.

questions.question: Which property is used to add a shadow to a box?
questions.explanation: The 'box-shadow' property attaches one or more shadows to an element.

questions.question: Which property is used to add a shadow to text?
questions.explanation: The 'text-shadow' property adds shadow to text.

questions.question: How do you add rounded corners to an element?
questions.explanation: The 'border-radius' property defines the radius of the element's corners.

questions.question: Which property allows you to change the transition speed of an effect?
questions.explanation: The 'transition-duration' property specifies how many seconds or milliseconds a transition effect takes to complete.

questions.question: What is Responsive Web Design?
options: A design that responds to the user's behavior and environment based on screen size, platform and orientation
Designing specific websites for mobile users
questions.explanation: Responsive web design (RWD) is an approach to web design that makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes.

questions.question: Which CSS rule is used to apply styles based on the device width?
questions.explanation: The @media rule is used in CSS to apply different styles for different media types/devices.

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used to represent self-contained content, like a blog post?
questions.explanation: The <article> element specifies independent, self-contained content.

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used to represent content aside from the content it is placed in (like a sidebar)?
questions.explanation: The <aside> element defines some content aside from the content it is placed in (like a sidebar).

questions.question: Which HTML5 attribute specifies where to open the linked document?
questions.explanation: The 'target' attribute specifies where to open the linked document.

questions.question: In HTML5, which tag is used for drawing graphics via scripting?
questions.explanation: The <canvas> element is used to draw graphics on a web page via JavaScript.

questions.question: Which HTML5 tag is used to define a container for an external application or interactive content (a plug-in)?
questions.explanation: The <embed> element defines a container for an external application or interactive content (a plug-in).

questions.question: What is the correct DOCTYPE for HTML5?
questions.explanation: In HTML5, the DOCTYPE declaration is very simple: <!DOCTYPE html>.

questions.question: Which property is used to create a multi-column layout in CSS3?
questions.explanation: The 'column-count' property specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into.

questions.question: Which CSS3 property is used to rotate an element?
questions.explanation: The 'transform' property applies a 2D or 3D transformation to an element, including rotation.

questions.question: Which CSS3 property is used to scale an element (make it larger or smaller)?
questions.explanation: The 'transform' property with the 'scale()' function is used to resize elements.

questions.question: Which property is used to specify how many times an animation should run?
questions.explanation: The 'animation-iteration-count' property specifies the number of times an animation should be played.

questions.question: Which property is used to define the animation name in CSS3?
questions.explanation: The 'animation-name' property specifies a name for the @keyframes animation.

questions.question: What is the @keyframes rule used for?
options: To define the style of a key
To define a new color variable
questions.explanation: The @keyframes rule specifies the animation code.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify that an input field is read-only?
questions.explanation: The 'readonly' attribute specifies that an input field is read-only.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to group related elements in a form?
questions.explanation: The <fieldset> element is used to group related elements in a form.

questions.question: Which HTML element provides a caption for a <fieldset>?
questions.explanation: The <legend> element defines a caption for the <fieldset> element.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify the relationship between the current document and the linked document?
questions.explanation: The 'rel' attribute specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

questions.question: The <meta> tag is used for:
questions.explanation: The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document.

questions.question: Which HTML element defines a multiline input field?
questions.explanation: The <textarea> element defines a multi-line text input control.

questions.question: Which element is used to group options in a drop-down list?
questions.explanation: The <optgroup> is used to group related options in a drop-down list.

questions.question: Which tag defines a table row?
questions.explanation: The <tr> element defines a row in an HTML table.

questions.question: Which tag defines a table header?
questions.explanation: The <th> element defines a header cell in an HTML table.

questions.question: Which tag defines a table cell?
questions.explanation: The <td> element defines a standard data cell in an HTML table.

questions.question: What is the correct order for the box model from inward to outward?
questions.explanation: The CSS box model consists of Content, Padding, Border, and Margin.

questions.question: How do you make an element invisible but still take up space?
questions.explanation: Both 'visibility:hidden' and 'opacity:0' hide the element while preserving its space in the layout.

questions.question: What does 'em' stand for in CSS?
options: A relative unit based on the font-size of the element
questions.explanation: 'em' is relative to the font-size of the element (2em means 2 times the current font size).

questions.question: What does 'rem' stand for in CSS?
options: Root EM (relative to <html> element font size)
questions.explanation: 'rem' is relative to the font-size of the root (html) element.

questions.question: Which unit is used for responsive layouts based on the viewport width?
questions.explanation: vw (viewport width) is 1% of the width of the viewport.

questions.question: Which unit is used for responsive layouts based on the viewport height?
questions.explanation: vh (viewport height) is 1% of the height of the viewport.

questions.question: What is the specificity of a class selector compared to an id selector?
questions.explanation: An ID selector has higher specificity than a class selector.

questions.question: What value of position makes an element positioned relative to its closest positioned ancestor?
questions.explanation: An element with 'position: absolute' is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor (instead of positioned relative to the viewport, like fixed).

questions.question: Which property is used to stack elements along the z-axis?
questions.explanation: The z-index property specifies the stack order of an element.

questions.question: Which selector matches every element on the page?
questions.explanation: The asterisk (*) is the universal selector in CSS.

questions.question: Which attribute on a <form> tag specifies the HTTP method to use?
questions.explanation: The 'method' attribute specifies the HTTP method (GET or POST) to use when submitting the form.

questions.question: Which attribute on a <form> tag specifies where to send the form data?
questions.explanation: The 'action' attribute specifies the URL where the form data should be sent.

questions.question: Which input type is used for hidden data?
questions.explanation: <input type="hidden"> is used for data that should not be shown to the user.

questions.question: Which attribute specifies a hint that describes the expected value of an input field?
questions.explanation: The 'placeholder' attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to group radio buttons together so only one can be selected?
questions.explanation: Radio buttons with the same 'name' attribute value belong to the same group.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to link a label with an input field?
questions.explanation: The <label> tag defines a label for several elements.

questions.question: Which attribute of the <label> tag allows it to link to an input's ID?
questions.explanation: The 'for' attribute of the <label> tag should be equal to the 'id' attribute of the related element to bind them together.

questions.question: Which HTML input type provides a slider control?
questions.explanation: <input type="range"> defines a range (slider) control.

questions.question: Which HTML input type allows the user to select multiple files?
questions.explanation: The 'multiple' attribute allows the user to select more than one value.

questions.question: Which attribute specifies that an input field should automatically get focus when the page loads?
questions.explanation: The 'autofocus' attribute specifies that an element should automatically get focus when the page loads.

questions.question: What does a > b select?
options: All b elements anywhere inside a
All b elements that are direct children of a
The first b element inside a
The b element immediately after a
questions.explanation: The child selector (>) selects all elements that are children of a specified element.

questions.question: What does a + b select?
options: The b element that is placed immediately after a
questions.explanation: The adjacent sibling selector (+) is used to select an element that is directly after another specific element.

questions.question: What does a ~ b select?
options: All b elements that are preceded by an a element
The last b element after a
The b element directly after a
questions.explanation: The general sibling selector (~) selects all elements that are next siblings of a specified element.

questions.question: How do you select only even numbered list items?
questions.explanation: Both nth-child(2n) and nth-child(even) select even-numbered children.

questions.question: How do you select an element when the mouse is over it?
questions.explanation: The :hover pseudo-class is used to select elements when you mouse over them.

questions.question: Which pseudo-class is used to select an input element that has focus?
questions.explanation: The :focus pseudo-class matches elements that have gain focus.

questions.question: Which pseudo-class is used to select every <a> element that has been visited?
questions.explanation: The :visited pseudo-class is used to select visited links.

questions.question: How do you select the first child of an element?
questions.explanation: Both :first-child and :nth-child(1) select the first child element.

questions.question: How do you select an element that has no children?
questions.explanation: The :empty pseudo-class matches every element that has no children (including text nodes).

questions.question: How do you select all elements with a 'disabled' attribute?
questions.explanation: [disabled] is an attribute selector, :disabled is a pseudo-class selector. Both work for disabled elements.

questions.question: In CSS Flexbox, what does flex-grow: 1 do?
options: Makes the item grow to take up available space
Gives the item a fixed width of 1px
Makes the item shrink if necessary
Sets the initial size of the item
questions.explanation: The flex-grow property specifies how much the item will grow relative to the rest of the flexible items inside the same container.

questions.question: In CSS Flexbox, what is the shorthand property for flex-grow, flex-shrink, and flex-basis?
questions.explanation: The 'flex' property is a shorthand for flex-grow, flex-shrink and flex-basis.

questions.question: Which property is used to specify the initial size of a flex item?
questions.explanation: The flex-basis property specifies the initial main size of a flex item.

questions.question: In CSS Grid, which unit represents a fraction of the available space?
questions.explanation: The 'fr' unit represents a fraction of the free space in the grid container.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to set the gap between grid rows and columns?
questions.explanation: 'grid-gap' was the original property, now simplified to 'gap' in both Grid and Flexbox.

questions.question: What does ARIA stand for in web development?
questions.explanation: ARIA is a set of attributes that help make web content and web applications more accessible to people with disabilities.

questions.question: Which attribute provides a text description for non-text content, such as icons?
questions.explanation: aria-label is used to define a string that labels the current element.

questions.question: Which tag is most important for SEO on a page?
questions.explanation: The <title> tag is one of the most important on-page SEO factors.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the canonical tag?
options: To tell search engines which version of a URL you want to appear in search results
To prevent images from being indexed
To define the language of the page
questions.explanation: Canonical tags help prevent duplicate content issues by specifying the 'master' version of a page.

questions.question: How do you specify the language of an HTML document?
questions.explanation: The 'lang' attribute on the <html> tag is used to specify the language of the document.
